      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      TileLayerOptions.Builder attribution(java.lang.String attribution)
      e.g.
      TileLayerOptions.Builder bounds(LatLngBounds bounds)
      When this option is set, the TileLayer only loads tiles that are in the given geographical bounds.
      TileLayerOptions build()
      Builds the TileLayerOptions new instance
      TileLayerOptions.Builder continuousWorld(java.lang.Boolean continuousWorld)
      If set to true, the tile coordinates won't be wrapped by world width (-180 to 180 longitude) or clamped to lie within world height (-90 to 90).
      TileLayerOptions.Builder detectRetina(java.lang.Boolean detectRetina)
      If true and user is on a retina display, it will request four tiles of half the specified size and a bigger zoom level in place of one to utilize the high resolution.
      TileLayerOptions.Builder errorTileUrl(java.lang.String errorTileUrl)
      URL to the tile image to show in place of the tile that failed to load.
      TileLayerOptions.Builder maxNativeZoom(java.lang.Number maxNativeZoom)
      Maximum zoom number the tiles source has available.
      TileLayerOptions.Builder maxZoom(java.lang.Number maxZoom)
      Maximum zoom number.
      TileLayerOptions.Builder minZoom(java.lang.Number minZoom)
      Minimum zoom number.
      TileLayerOptions.Builder noWrap(java.lang.Boolean noWrap)
      If set to true, the tiles just won't load outside the world width (-180 to 180 longitude) instead of repeating.
      TileLayerOptions.Builder opacity(java.lang.Number opacity)
      The opacity of the tile layer.
      TileLayerOptions.Builder reuseTiles(java.lang.Boolean reuseTiles)
      If true, all the tiles that are not visible after panning are placed in a reuse queue from which they will be fetched when new tiles become visible (as opposed to dynamically creating new ones).
      TileLayerOptions.Builder subdomains(java.lang.String[] subdomains)
      Subdomains of the tile service.
      TileLayerOptions.Builder tileSize(java.lang.Number tileSize)
      Tile size (width and height in pixels, assuming tiles are square).
      TileLayerOptions.Builder tms(java.lang.Boolean tms)
      If true, inverses Y axis numbering for tiles (turn this on for TMS services).
      TileLayerOptions.Builder unloadInvisibleTiles(java.lang.Boolean unloadInvisibleTiles)
      If true, all the tiles that are not visible after panning are removed (for better performance).
      TileLayerOptions.Builder updateWhenIdle(java.lang.Boolean updateWhenIdle)
      If false, new tiles are loaded during panning, otherwise only after it (for better performance).
      TileLayerOptions.Builder zIndex(java.lang.Number zIndex)
      The explicit zIndex of the tile layer.
      TileLayerOptions.Builder zoomOffset(java.lang.Number zoomOffset)
      The zoom number used in tile URLs will be offset with this value.
      TileLayerOptions.Builder zoomReverse(java.lang.Boolean zoomReverse)
      If set to true, the zoom number used in tile URLs will be reversed (maxZoom - zoom instead of zoom).

      • maxNativeZoom

        public TileLayerOptions.Builder maxNativeZoom(java.lang.Number maxNativeZoom)
        Maximum zoom number the tiles source has available. If it is specified, the tiles on all zoom levels higher than maxNativeZoom will be loaded from maxNativeZoom level and auto-scaled.
        default null
        Parameters:
        maxNativeZoom - the max native zoom
        Returns:
        the builder

      • tileSize

        public TileLayerOptions.Builder tileSize(java.lang.Number tileSize)
        Tile size (width and height in pixels, assuming tiles are square).
        default 256
        Parameters:
        tileSize - the tile size
        Returns:
        the builder

      • subdomains

        public TileLayerOptions.Builder subdomains(java.lang.String[] subdomains)
        Subdomains of the tile service. Can be passed in the form of one string (where each letter is a subdomain name) or an array of strings.
        default {"abc"}
        Parameters:
        subdomains - the subdomains
        Returns:
        the builder

      • attribution

        public TileLayerOptions.Builder attribution(java.lang.String attribution)
        e.g. "© Mapbox" — the string used by the attribution control, describes the layer data.
        default ""
        Parameters:
        attribution - the attribution
        Returns:
        the builder

      • tms

        public TileLayerOptions.Builder tms(java.lang.Boolean tms)
        If true, inverses Y axis numbering for tiles (turn this on for TMS services).
        default true
        Parameters:
        tms - the tms
        Returns:
        the builder

      • continuousWorld

        public TileLayerOptions.Builder continuousWorld(java.lang.Boolean continuousWorld)
        If set to true, the tile coordinates won't be wrapped by world width (-180 to 180 longitude) or clamped to lie within world height (-90 to 90). Use this if you use Leaflet for maps that don't reflect the real world (e.g. game, indoor or photo maps).
        default false
        Parameters:
        continuousWorld - the continuous world
        Returns:
        the builder

      • noWrap

        public TileLayerOptions.Builder noWrap(java.lang.Boolean noWrap)
        If set to true, the tiles just won't load outside the world width (-180 to 180 longitude) instead of repeating. default false
        Parameters:
        noWrap - the no wrap
        Returns:
        the builder

      • zoomOffset

        public TileLayerOptions.Builder zoomOffset(java.lang.Number zoomOffset)
        The zoom number used in tile URLs will be offset with this value.
        default 0
        Parameters:
        zoomOffset - the zoom offset
        Returns:
        the builder

      • zoomReverse

        public TileLayerOptions.Builder zoomReverse(java.lang.Boolean zoomReverse)
        If set to true, the zoom number used in tile URLs will be reversed (maxZoom - zoom instead of zoom).
        default false
        Parameters:
        zoomReverse - the zoom reverse
        Returns:
        the builder

      • opacity

        public TileLayerOptions.Builder opacity(java.lang.Number opacity)
        The opacity of the tile layer.
        default 1.0
        Parameters:
        opacity - the opacity
        Returns:
        the builder

      • zIndex

        public TileLayerOptions.Builder zIndex(java.lang.Number zIndex)
        The explicit zIndex of the tile layer. Not set by default.
        default null
        Parameters:
        zIndex - the z index
        Returns:
        the builder

      • unloadInvisibleTiles

        public TileLayerOptions.Builder unloadInvisibleTiles(java.lang.Boolean unloadInvisibleTiles)
        If true, all the tiles that are not visible after panning are removed (for better performance). true by default on mobile WebKit, otherwise false.
        default true
        Parameters:
        unloadInvisibleTiles - the unload invisible tiles
        Returns:
        the builder

      • updateWhenIdle

        public TileLayerOptions.Builder updateWhenIdle(java.lang.Boolean updateWhenIdle)
        If false, new tiles are loaded during panning, otherwise only after it (for better performance). true by default on mobile WebKit, otherwise false.
        default true
        Parameters:
        updateWhenIdle - the update when idle
        Returns:
        the builder

      • detectRetina

        public TileLayerOptions.Builder detectRetina(java.lang.Boolean detectRetina)
        If true and user is on a retina display, it will request four tiles of half the specified size and a bigger zoom level in place of one to utilize the high resolution.
        default false
        Parameters:
        detectRetina - the detect retina
        Returns:
        the builder

      • reuseTiles

        public TileLayerOptions.Builder reuseTiles(java.lang.Boolean reuseTiles)
        If true, all the tiles that are not visible after panning are placed in a reuse queue from which they will be fetched when new tiles become visible (as opposed to dynamically creating new ones). This will in theory keep memory usage low and eliminate the need for reserving new memory whenever a new tile is needed.
        default false
        Parameters:
        reuseTiles - the reuse tiles
        Returns:
        the builder

      • bounds

        public TileLayerOptions.Builder bounds(LatLngBounds bounds)
        When this option is set, the TileLayer only loads tiles that are in the given geographical bounds.
        default null
        Parameters:
        bounds - the bounds
        Returns:
        the builder

        public TileLayerOptions build()
        Builds the TileLayerOptions new instance
        Returns:
        the tile layer options
